dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C. 2010. Cambarellus patzcuarensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: This species is known from its type locality in Lake Patzcuaro, Michoacán, Mexico (Hobbs 1974). This lake has a surface area of 130 km2 (Torres 1993) and is at an altitude of 2,035 m above sea level (Bradbury 2000). Furthermore, this species is also known to occur in springs in Chapultepec, Opopeo and Tzurumutaro, Mexico (M. López-Mejía., F. Alvarez. and C. Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2009). Although the basin is 982km2 this species is probably restricted to a limited area around the lake (C. Pedraza-Lara pers. comm 2010). It has been estimated that this species occurs in an area of approximately 200 km2.

dataObjects.title: Habitat and Ecology

dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C. 2010. Cambarellus patzcuarensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Habitat and Ecology
This species is known from its type locality in Lake Patzcuaro, Michoacán, Mexico (Hobbs 1974). This lake has a surface area of 130 km2 (Torres 1993) and is at an altitude of 2,035 m above sea level (Bradbury 2000). It is a warm polymictic lake, with a mean depth of 4.9 m and a maximum depth of 12 m (Torres 1993). Furthermore, this species is also known to occur in springs in Chapultepec, Opopeo and Tzurumutaro, Mexico (M. López-Mejía., F. Alvarez. and C. Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2009). These are usually to be isolated populations (Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2010).

Systems
  • Freshwater

agents.full_name: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.
Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C. 2010. Cambarellus patzcuarensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
EN
Endangered

Red List Criteria
B1ab(iii)

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.

Reviewer/s
Collen, B. & Richman, N.

Contributor/s
Livingston, F., Livingston, F., Soulsby, A.-M., Batchelor, A., Dyer, E., Whitton, F., Milligan, H.T., Smith, J., Lutz, M.L., De Silva, R., McGuinness, S., Kasthala, G., Jopling, B., Sullivan, K. & Cryer, G.

Justification

Cambarellus patzcuarensis has been assessed as Endangered under criterion B1ab(iii). This species has an Extent of Occurrence of approximately 200 km2 and is only known from 1 - 5 locations based on ongoing water abstraction and pollution incidents. Aquatic systems in which this species is found, have been impacted by a variety of threats though the effects of these on population numbers is not known and therefore warrants further investigation. Should the population be found to be relatively stable, then this species would warrant listing under Near Threatened.

agents.full_name: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.
Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Trends
dataObjects.title: Population
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C. 2010. Cambarellus patzcuarensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Population
This species is thought to be abundant; in the1950s 400 individuals were collected during survey work. Furthermore, survey work conducted surrounding Janitzio Island within Lake Patzcuaro describes this species as abundant (M. López-Mejía., F. Alvarez. and C. Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2009).

Population Trend
Unknown

agents.full_name: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.
Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Threats
dataObjects.title: Threats
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C. 2010. Cambarellus patzcuarensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Major Threats
Lake Patzcuaro is under threat from increasing siltation rates and inputs of raw sewage (Torres 1993). The lake basin is highly developed, with cattle ranching, water abstraction and deforestation occurring. Furthermore, this species is occasionally taken as by-catch and consumed (M. López-Mejía., F. Alvarez. and C. Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2009). However, it is not known what impact these threats may be having on this species (M. López-Mejía., F. Alvarez. and C. Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2009) .

agents.full_name: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.
Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Management
dataObjects.title: Conservation Actions
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C. 2010. Cambarellus patzcuarensis. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Conservation Actions
There are no species-specific conservation measures in place for this species, however Lake Pátzcuaro is a RAMSAR site (Pedraza-Lara pers. comm. 2010). Further research is needed to look at population trends and how it has been impacted by the range of threats.

agents.full_name: Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.
Alvarez, F., López-Mejía, M. & Pedraza Lara, C.

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Cambarellus patzcuarensis
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Cambarellus patzcuarensis." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 19 Mar 2013, 02:08 UTC. 25 Jan 2014 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Cambarellus_patzcuarensis&oldid=588191283>.
dataObjects.description:
Cambarellus patzcuarensis is a crayfish in the family Cambaridae.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Distribution
  • 3 Conservation
  • 4 References

Description[edit]

It has a body measuring 4–5 centimetres (1.6–2.0 in), including claws. Most specimens found in the wild are brown, sometimes with a gray or blue tint. Cambarellus patzcuarensis var. "Orange" (Mexican dwarf crayfish, sometimes Mexican dwarf orange crayfish) is an orange-coloured mutation often held in aquariums, but this form is rarely found in the wild.[2]

Distribution[edit]

The species is named after Lake Pátzcuaro, at an altitude of 2,035 metres (6,677 ft) in Michoacán, Mexico. As well as Lake Pátzcuaro, C. patzcuarensis also occurs in springs in Chapultepec, Opopeo and Tzurumutaro.[3]

Conservation[edit]

C. patzcuarensis is listed as an endangered species on the IUCN Red List.[3]

References[edit]

Crustaceans portal
  1. ^ "Cambarellus patzcuarensis". Integrated Taxonomic Information System. Retrieved October 5, 2010. 
  2. ^ Gerald Pottern. "Mexican Dwarf Orange Crayfish, Cambarellus patzcuarensis". Petshrimp.com. Archived from the original on April 1, 2008. Retrieved May 16, 2008. 
  3. ^ a b F. Alvarez, M. López-Mejía & C. Pedraza Lara (2010). "Cambarellus patzcuarensis". IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 3.1. International Union for Conservation of Nature. Retrieved February 15, 2012.
